document_title: Pork tapeworm infection: Causes, symptoms, treatment, prevention
subsection_content:
Once inside the body, the larvae can escape from the intestines and infect other tissues and organs in the body, causing organ damage and, in severe cases, death.
Neurocysticerci infection is a dangerous complication of pork tapeworm infection. The brain and nervous system are affected. Sufferers may experience symptoms of headaches, vision problems, seizures, meningitis and confusion. In very serious cases, the infection can be fatal.
